details: Adding persistent font family selection for dimension label text.
Fixing extension panel icons.
Releasing as Adobe Exchange compatible extension.
Updating artwork files and external URLs.
User-defined options, styles, and settings are now persistent after closing and re-opening application.
Changed custom scale dropdown to an editable text field to allow for a scales ranging from 1/1 to 1/999.
Properly convert stroke width, gap, and head and tail units.
Code formatting - no script/extension changes.
Reverting to CEP 9 (Adobe needs to get it together - causing crashes when developers aren't even changing code).
Update for CEP 10
Adjusting default stroke width to 1 unit (instead of 0.5).
Updated internal build process.
Minor patch, simply adjusts the default stroke width to 1 unit (instead of 0.5).
New Dialog UI and Adobe Extension.
This release completely updates the Specify dialog UI, and adds a version packaged as Free Extension available via Adobe Exchange for Illustrator CC users.

Resolves "out of specified range" error for font size input less than 1.0 by automatically adding a leading zero to the font size field if user enters a value such as .25 instead of 0.25. For reference, font sizes require a leading zero on input.
User-defined custom scale for dimensions and labels.

This release enables the user to specify a working scale along with allowing for customizable unit labels. For example, if you are designing an engineering drawing at 1/4 scale (or 1:4), you simply choose this ratio from the SCALE dropdown menu, and then enable a Custom Units Label that corresponds to the unit labels to output.
Prevents the script from generating a dashed line when specifying the dimensions of an object with dashed paths.
The font size input in the options panel now allows the user to specify the size of the label text in the same units as the document ruler.

Also fixed a bug with the help text that appears when hovering over an input field in the Specify dialog box. Help text was showing the current settings as Defaults rather than the script's default values.
Implemented environmental variables to persist settings (to persist options between running the script multiple times, even between multiple documents) until application is closed.
Added a 'Restore Defaults' button to roll back to initial settings.
Removed 'Advanced Options' toggle and section; moved all items into 'Options' panel.
Refactored code.
Now possible to specify multiple objects simultaneously.
Added 'Select All' option to easily select all dimensions to specify.
Added 'Advanced Options' panel.
Easily change font size.
Easily change RGB color of dimension lines and labels.
Easily change number of decimal places for dimension labels.
Fixed issue with label spacing.
Improved UI of dialog box and options.
Added help tips (hover over options in dialog).
Updated 'Specify' button and added 'Cancel' button.
Improved error handling.
Refactored code.
Initial release.
